info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF COLLETON COUNTY... At 601 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Ritter, or 9 miles southeast of Walterboro, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Walterboro, Cottageville, Hendersonville, Round O, Green Pond, Jacksonboro, Ashepoo and Ritter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
